entry.title: Simplify form import requirement checking + metrics
entry.content:
Currently, FormDataImporter::LogAddressFormImportRequirementMetric()

is responsible for:

- Checking if the profile meets the minimum import requirements

- Logging this to autofill-internals.

- Emitting UMA metrics around it.



This leads to interesting looking lines like this:

bool all_fulfilled = LogAddressFormImportRequirementMetric(

candidate_profile, import_log_buffer) &&

!has_invalid_information;



This CL:

- Removes FormDataImporter::LogAddressFormImportRequirementMetric().

- Instead uses the existing IsMinimumAddress() function from

profile_requirement_utils.h to compute `all_fulfilled`.

- Adds an optional LogBuffer parameter to IsMinimumAddress(), making

it responsible to log to autofill-internals.

- Adds autofill_metrics::LogAddressFormImportRequirementMetric(),

which logs UMA metrics around the import requirements, essentially

what is currently done in

FormDataImporter::LogAddressFormImportRequirementMetric().

- Merges LogAddressFormImportCountrySpecificFieldRequirementsMetric()

into the new LogAddressFormImportRequirementMetric().



The Cl also makes some cosmetical changes in profile_requirement_utils:

- Renames GetAutofillProfileRequirementResult() to

ValidateProfileImportRequirements().

- Moves kMinimumAddressRequirementViolations to an anonymous namespace

in the cc file.

- Rephrases some of the comments.



Some technical notes:

- By splitting the metric emission and the actual completeness check,

requirements are checked twice now. Arguably, this is worth the better

separation of the logic.

- Currently, the logic constructs a flat_set from the vector of

requirements, to efficiently check whether some of them are violated.

Since only ~4-ish requirements are explicitly checked that way, this

CL instead just uses base::Contains(). This is likely faster than

sorting.



Bug: 1503645

Change-Id: Iae2d734e53d2efac243932f7752e58052daa786d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5040498

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

entry.title: [fuzztest] Enable sharing fuzztest outside of Chromium
entry.content:
For using the fuzztest dependency in V8, we also need its BUILD.gn

file.



To avoid forking the file, we plan to include it as separate

copybara repo. This, however, depends on boringssl and

libFuzzer which both are further intertwined with Chromium

sources, not available in V8. Since they aren't required to build

fuzztest with centipede, this puts them behind the

build_with_chromium flag, as done in several other dependencies.



Within Chromium, this change should be a no-op.



Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:linux-centipede-asan-rel

Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:linux-libfuzzer-asan-rel

entry.title: Add logic for matching URIs to AwMediaIntegrityApiStatusConfig
entry.content:
This config will be used to match given URIs against the origin pattern

rules set by the client. The matching is done using an

AwContentsOriginMatcher. This is expensive to create for every

individual lookup call, hence optimising rule list for each permission.

entry.title: [DownloadBubble] Use ShowInactive to avoid stealing input focus
entry.content:
This makes the download bubble partial view always use ShowInactive

so that it does not steal focus from the page when it pops up. In order

to close the bubble from such a state, an EventObserver is installed to

listen for mouse events, Esc key press, and touch events, which will

trigger closing the bubble. The bubble can be focused using an

accelerator for accessibility purposes.



Bug: 1484657, 1498481

entry.title: Enable PkpTest for HttpEngineNativeCronetProvider
entry.content:
These were failing due to the bypassing of key pinning for local

anchors, as this was getting in the way of dropping MockCertVerifier

in favor of locally trusted root certificates.



It's not entirely clear to me why we were setting that in the first

place, except for tests which explicitly test for that behavior (i.e.

the default should be ENABLE_PINNING_BYPASS_FOR_LOCAL_ANCHORS, as

that enables more code to be tested?).



Also, always use an unknown root certificate when setting up

MockCertVerifier, as that more closely resembles the

non-MockCertVerifier scenario (where we use a non-trusted self signed

certificate).



Bug: 1494845, 1501033

Change-Id: I884c4d6b8acaebf24a11414a311a72ac8c4d110b

entry.title: [ios] Fix layout issue after undoing a "close all tabs" operation
entry.content:
To fix a visual glitch when undoing the "close all tabs" operation

restore both active and inactive tabs (the restoration happening in

two steps), the tiles are inserted with a size of 0.



With the current implementation of the undo (which save the session

when closing the tabs and restore the session to perform the undo),

some tabs will perform a navigation as part of the restoration. The

navigation will eventually result in a relayout (e.g. when the tab

title changes) which will set the correct dimension on the tiles.



If no navigation happens as part of the session restoration (e.g. if

the active tab is pinned, and there are no active unpinned tabs) or

if the navigation is too slow (e.g. slow network), then the tab grid

will appear empty. If the user tap "done" at this point, the UI will

try to animate a tab of size 0, leading to a CHECK failure in the

method -scaleTabViews.



To fix this, invalidate the layout after the whole undo operation is

complete, forcing the correct dimension to be computed for the tiles.



Fixed: 1427258

Bug: 1383087

Change-Id: I11e6e2769b644527e16b91b23175e7c8c94c74e9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5040433

entry.title: SmartCard: Use a fake device service in ChromeOS Linux builds
entry.content:
When making a ChromeOS build for Linux, ie, to be run in development

Linux machines as opposed to an actual ChromeOS device, use a fake smart

card device service to make manual testing possible. Specially when

there's no physical access to the dev machine (ie, it's being accessed

remotely), where not only it's missing the needed component but you also

cannot attach the needed hardware. And smart card hardware (readers and

cards) are not very easy to get anyway.



Useful while developing or manually testing related UIs such as its

permission prompt.



Bug: 1386175

Change-Id: I2852faf3ec0f3bbdf9b8669460f1b6c71b41a3e0

entry.title: Use C++20 default comparison operator in components/autofill
entry.content:
As per [1], defaulting the comparison operator is now supported in

Chromium. This applies the base class's comparison operator, followed

by comparisons for all members in declaration order (short-circuiting).

As per [2], this also allows for inequality comparison.



This CL applies the default comparisons in components/autofill, in

places where it is a no-op.



[1] https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/styleguide/c++/c++-features.md#default-comparisons-allowed

[2] https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/default_comparisons#:~:text=Per%20the%20rules%20for%20operator%3D%3D%2C%20this%20will%20also%20allow%20inequality%20testing%3A



Bug: 1414530

entry.title: [@position-fallback] Consider position-fallback for LayoutUpgrades
entry.content:
A call to update the style and layout tree may be "upgraded"

to also include *layout* if style has layout dependencies

(i.e. depends on container queries).



With the new @position-fallback model, any element that's

affected by @try rules now has layout dependencies as well.

Therefore, this CL includes position-fallback in the checks used

to determine if a layout upgrade should take place.



This fixes transitions that sometimes occur out of "thin air"

when loading the page.



Bug: 1309178

entry.title: Fix invalid memchr call in CSSVariableParser
entry.content:
Due to a C language bug, memchr cannot be called on spans represented by

NULL, 0. C++ broadly fixes this bug but inherits it in functions carried

over from C. See this UBSan failure:

https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/build-8764051389942365569/test-results?q=CrComponentsFocusTest.MostVisited&sortby=&groupby=



Instead, just use base::Contains on Span8(). This avoids the UB, is

easier to read, and is safer since we don't dip into raw pointers.



Bug: 1394755

entry.title: Generic KeyType for AutofillDataModelChange
entry.content:
AutofillDataModelChange is the class behind AutofillProfileChange,

CreditCardChange, etc. It essentially just encapsulates a data model,

plus the type of the change (add, update, remove). For removals, when

the data model might not be present, its constructor also requires a

key (e.g. the GUID of the removed profile).



Currently, this key is always a string. This is suboptimal, because:

- For ServerCvcChange the int64_t instrument_id is used as a key,

which requires additional conversions.

- For local IBANs, the string GUID is used, while for server IBANs,

the int64_t instrument_id is used. By having a generic key type,

this can become a variant.

- For local CreditCards, a string GUID is used, while for server cards,

a string server_id is used. This should eventually become an

instrument id as well.



This CL adds an additional template parameter, which allows specifying

the type of the key. It also changes the ServerCvcChange key type to

int64_t, and the IbanChange key type to the aforementioned variant. For

CreditCard, a separate CLs will be necessary, since there are many more

uses.



This is a first step towards the goal of making the data model optional

for remove operations (which it currently is not).



Finally, this CL replaces a static_assert in AutofillDataModelChange

with a concept.



Bug: 1007974

Change-Id: I8cb3bb7d4237dcf10545df9b0154377a771465ec

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5038704

Reviewed-by: Jan Keitel

entry.title: Use SessionId of cached form.
entry.content:
To allow the Autofill framework to use cached results from a previous

prefill request, the form used to start an Autofill session must

have the same session id as the form from the prefill request. Only

then will the fields have the same virtual ids.



This CL adds logic to achieve that. It re-uses the session id of the

cached form iff:

- There is a cached form.

- The cached form is similar to the form the user has just focused.

- No bottom sheet has been shown before.



Otherwise it generated a new session id.



Bug: 1502097

Change-Id: I13a611acaf8547fc99137bfe7ff838b0373ce7e9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5038706

entry.title: Fix overflows in ReportImagePixelInaccuracy
entry.content:
Sticking a saturated cast at the end doesn't help if the underlying

operation overflows.



Instead, for fetched_pixels, use the preexisting Area64 method.

needed_pixels and capped_pixels are broadly doing work in floating point

space, so they don't worry about overflows. But it's not obvious

what order the multiplications are happening in (i.e. whether

layout_width * layout_height can overflow), so add some parenthesis to

make it clearer.



Finally, the overfetched_* subtractions are odd. They doing the

operation as unsigned integers (which will wraparound) and then casting

to the negative value. Instead, since we only record the histogram on

positive values anyway, rearrange the logic to avoid the negative case

at all.



This fixes a UBSan failure reported here:

https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/build-8764165598299826001/test-results?q=WebMeaningfulLayoutsTest.NoOverflowInIncrementVisuallyNonEmptyPixelCount&sortby=&groupby=



Bug: 1394755

Change-Id: Ie1d5f7d6202267be18710e6ba0d5ee9b52650533

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5041338

Auto-Submit: David Benjamin

Reviewed-by: Yoav Weiss

Commit-Queue: Yoav Weiss

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1226697}

entry.title: Prerender: Add WPT infra to activate prerendering with target hint
entry.content:
This CL adds WPT test helpers to activate a prerendered page with target

hint "_blank" (i.e., prerender-into-new-tab), and runs an existing tests

as a reference. Follow-up CLs will run more existing tests.



In addition to that, this CL adds kPrerender2AllowActivationInBackground

that allows activation in background tabs. This is a workaround to run

prerender activation for target hint "_blank" on web platform tests on

macOS, and is never enabled other than WPT (for now). On the platform,

looks like there is a race condition between visibility change and

activation start on a prerender WebContents. This results in

PrerenderFinalStatus::kActivatedInBackground. Note that this issue

doesn't happen on content_browsertests, so this could be specific to

WPT setup.



Bug: 1399709, 1501674

Change-Id: I20465ebeda014b7a828db6428971f5505a874487

entry.title: Revert "Add a new form-factor client hints value for XR"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 6e8e61d8458872eaeb99d6c9adbc05692a2d9f84.



Reason for revert: Breaks headless tests



Original change's description:

> Add a new form-factor client hints value for XR

>

> Use "XR" as the hint when --enable-features=ClientHintsXRFormFactor

> is passed to Chrome. This makes the client hints implementation even

> closer to the draft at https://wicg.github.io/ua-client-hints/.

>

> BUG=1442238

> TEST=components_unittests

> TEST=Launch Clank with --enable-features=ClientHintsFormFactor,ClientHintsXRFormFactor.

> Inspect Clank in a desktop Chrome and run

> `navigator.userAgentData.getHighEntropyValues(["formFactor"])

> .then(function(v) { console.log(v); })` in the console. Verify that

> form_factor is set to {"Mobile","XR"}.

> TEST=Do the same test with the "Desktop site" menu checked.

>

> Change-Id: Id07af43e18ba31959f54decc5ae0eaadd462b606

entry.title: [SysUi download integration] Add notification display client
entry.content:
This CL creates a client that displays download notifications. This

CL implements the following functionalities:



1. A download notification shows for a new download.



2. The download notification is removed if its corresponding download

is cancelled or interrupted.



In this CL, the download notification is not filled with data

carried by DisplayMetadata, which will be implemented subsequently.

entry.title: cros-apps: implement origin-based access control
entry.content:
This CL implements origin-based access control for ChromeOS Apps APIs.



* CrosAppsApiRegistry: a read-only interface that exposes query methods

* CrosAppsApiMutableRegistry: implements CrosAppsApiRegistry and

provides methods to modify access control behaviors



The CL also adds test origins for the Diagnostics API.

entry.title: Fix renderer content settings (part 7 / N)
entry.content:
Remove redundant code from AWContentSettingsClient.



On navigation failure, the renderer sets the URL to

kUnreachableWebDataURL and uses default renderer content settings, which

allow script and image. There's no need for the AWContentSettingsClient

to check for kUnreachableWebDataURL and force-enable script and image,

since that's the default.

entry.content:
This cleans up the `SetUp()` and `TearDown()` methods significantly. The

global `DlcserviceClient` is set in the constructor, and unset in the

destructor, so this effectively provides a scoped test

`DlcserviceClient`.



Three other unit tests (ambient_controller, time_of_day_utils and

handwriting_model_loader) use the same pattern.



This also removes a DanglingUntriaged pointer as a result.

entry.title: language_pack_manager: Init and shut down with `DlcserviceClient`
entry.content:
Before this CL, `DlcserviceClient` is a singleton using

`base::NoDestructor`, which is instantiated in a thread-safe mannger the

first time `GetInstance()` is called.



In tests, `DlcserviceClient` is repeatedly constructed and destructed,

but `LanguagePackManager` remains a singleton. The observer in the

`LanguagePackManager` is not updated after the first test, resulting in

DLC observer test failures if it was not the first test run.



To fix this, there are various solutions:



- Reset the observer to `DlcserviceClient` inside the existing

`ResetForTesting()` method. While this would result in a small change,

we would continue to encounter bugs stemming from the root cause of

"class state was forgotten to be reset in `ResetForTesting()`".



- Replace `base::NoDestructor` with a global heap-allocated instance,

instantiated in `GetInstance` if it does not exist. For tests, there

are two possible alternatives:

- Destroy the global instance during tests using a new

`ShutdownForTesting()` static method, which replaces

`ResetForTesting()`.

- Use a test-local `LanguagePackManager` instance.

Unfortunately, this would make `GetInstance()` not thread safe (unless

a mutex is used).



- Make `LanguagePackManager` owned by a parent class, likely

`ash::Shell`, and instantiate a test-local `LanguagePackManager` in

tests. This would also eliminate all the bugs stemming from forgetting

to reset state, while keeping `GetInstance()` thread safe.

While this is a good idea in theory, this unfortunately causes test

crashes in other tests which instantiate `ash::Shell` - these test

instantiate a `LanguagePackManager` without a global

`DlcserviceClient`, causing `LanguagePackManager` to observe a nullptr

`DlcserviceClient` and crash.



- Replace `base::NoDestructor` with a global heap-allocated instance,

instantiated and shut down in the same code paths that

`DlcserviceClient` is instantiated and shut down. For tests, we have

the same two alternatives as the previous global heap-allocated

instance solution.

This addresses the shortcomings of the previous two solutions, and

aligns us with `DlcserviceClient` to ensure that we should never

instantiate `LanguagePackManager` without a valid global

`DlcserviceClient`.



Out of all the solutions, only the last one does not have any

shortcomings, and so is implemented in this CL.



To ensure that tests are clean, we set the global instance from the

`LanguagePackManager` constructors and destructors, so a test-scoped

`LanguagePackManager` can easily be constructed by having a local

variable in a test. The alternative, having a `ShutdownForTesting()`

static method, would require explicit shutdown logic in tests instead of

using RAII.



Bug: b:294162606

Fixed: b:309562217

Change-Id: I452329b327db83fd541265f020070e140628a8b7

entry.title: Add cert_is_issued_by_known_root field in net::TransportInfo
entry.content:
We are planning to use this field to decide whether to use stored

compression dictionaries.



So this CL adds cert_is_issued_by_known_root field in TransportInfo. So

that the ConnectedCallback can check it.



This CL also changes HttpBasicStream::GetSSLInfo() and

WebSocketBasicHandshakeStream::GetSSLInfo() not to use

HttpStreamParser::GetSSLInfo() because we want call these methods before

initializing the HttpStreamParser.



HttpNetworkTransaction::DoConnectedCallback() is called before

HttpNetworkTransaction::DoInitStream() initializes the HttpStreamParser.



- HttpNetworkTransaction::DoConnectedCallback()

- HttpNetworkTransaction::DoInitStream()

-> HttpBasicStream::InitializeStream()

-> HttpBasicState::Initialize()

-> std::make_unique()



Bug: 1413922
